extendedIngredients.name: oil packed tuna
extendedIngredients.original: 1 7-ounce jar olive oil-packed tuna, drained and flaked
extendedIngredients.originalName: olive oil-packed tuna, drained and flaked

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small roasted red pepper, coarsely chopped (1/2 cup)
extendedIngredients.originalName: small roasted red pepper, coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.original: 5 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature

title: Tuna-Red Pepper Mousse Toasts
summary: Tuna-Red Pepper Mousse Toasts is a pescatarian recipe with 24 servings. One serving contains 721 calories, 25g of protein, and 12g of fat. For $2.29 per serving, this recipe covers 29% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 20 minutes. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have butter, salt and pepper, pine nuts, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. With a spoonacular score of 68%, this dish is pretty good. Try Cook the Book: Red Pepper Mousse with Garlic Toasts, Easy Roasted Red Pepper Dip, and roasted tomato and red pepper dip for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are great choices for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. One wine you could try is Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 34 dollars.

productMatches.title: Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot
productMatches.description:
Our 2006 Merlot isn't shy, with its deep, dark garnet hue and abounding aromas of rich black
cherry, cassis and clove. Approachable, integrated tannins frame the generous dark fruit
flavors and coat the palate with soft velvet. The long, fruity finish, laced with autumn spices,
ends with a lively cranberry zing. "This is a very classy wine from a gorgeous vintage. Take
that, Miles!" laughs Winemaker Tom Rinaldi, with a reference to the film Sideways.

instructions: In a food processor, combine 4 tablespoons of the butter with the tuna and red pepper and process to a coarse puree. Season with salt and pepper.                                              In a small skillet, melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Add the pine nuts and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 3 minutes.                                              Spread about 2 teaspoons of tuna mousse on each toast and transfer to a platter. Garnish with the toasted pine nuts and serve.

steps.step: In a food processor, combine 4 tablespoons of the butter with the tuna and red pepper and process to a coarse puree. Season with salt and pepper.
In a small skillet, melt the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter.
Add the pine nuts and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
Spread about 2 teaspoons of tuna mousse on each toast and transfer to a platter.
Garnish with the toasted pine nuts and serve.
